question.name: 13.3.2.5 Area under a curve
question.questiontext:
Exercise

In each question you should check that the required area lies entirely above the horizontal axis.


  1. Find the area under the curve \(y={@exp1@}\) and above the x-axis between \(x = {@l1@}\) and \(x = {@u1@}\). [[input:ans1]] [[validation:ans1]] [[feedback:prt1]]

  2. Find the area bounded by the curve \(y={@exp2@}\) and the x-axis between \(x = {@l2@}\) and \(x = {@u2@}\). [[input:ans2]] [[validation:ans2]] [[feedback:prt2]]
question.generalfeedback:
Since the required area lies entirely above the horizontal axis for each question, the area under the curve \(y\) between \(x = a\) and \(x = b\) is \(\displaystyle\int_{a}^{b} y(x) \, \mathrm{d}x\).


  1. \(\displaystyle \int_{@l1@}^{@u1@}{@exp1@}\, \mathrm{d}x = \left[ {@int(exp1,x)@} \right]_{@l1@}^{@u1@} = {@ta1@}\).

  2. \(\displaystyle \int_{@l2@}^{@u2@}{@exp2@}\, \mathrm{d}x =\left[ {@int(exp2,x)@} \right]_{@l2@}^{@u2@} = {@ta2@}\).
